newsitem.title: UK: BFI down two but Atlantic Panamaxes firm slightly.
newsitem.headline: BFI down two but Atlantic Panamaxes firm slightly.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was down two at 1,245 points on Monday.
Brokers reported quiet conditions at the beginning of the week but a few slightly firmer Panamax fixtures in the Atlantic.
Cargill fixed Eleni 73,000 dwt delivery Genoa June 10/16 for one or two laden-legs via East Coast South America redelivery Gibraltar-Hamburg rage at a steadier $9,925 daily.
Cargill still quoted $20 no combo for their 54,000 heavy grain USGulf to Japan for end-June.
Capers contiuned strong and active in the Atlantic but Handy-sizes were continuing to weaken.
At 1200 GMT BIFFEX was five points higher in the only position traded, June. Turnover was 10 lots.
